meanings.definition: Instruct or question (someone) systematically, especially in Christian doctrine.
meanings.sent1: The priest will catechise the children on the teachings of the Bible.
meanings.sent2: She decided to catechise her students on the importance of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to catechise the cat on how to meow, but it was unsuccessful.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl would catechise the young birds on the ways of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful pictures to catechise the students on the alphabet.

meanings.sent1: The mentor would catechise the apprentice to help them learn new skills.
meanings.sent2: He would often catechise his students to encourage critical thinking.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to catechise the suspect to get more information about the crime.
meanings.sent4: The coach would catechise the players to improve their performance on the field.
meanings.sent5: The parent would catechise the child to help them understand the importance of honesty.
